data.name: character N-gram generator
data.description:
According to Wikipedia: "an n-gram is a contiguous sequence of n items from a given sample of text or speech. The items can be phonemes, syllables, letters, words or base pairs according to the application."

the goal in this kata is to take a string and generate a set of n grams of the characters in the text.  for any n that is <= the length of the text. If the given n is greater than the length of the text the "N_gram" function should should return "N is to large". If the given n is less than or equal to 0 the function should return an empty list. The function shouldn't change the input text in any way, keep spaces and capital letters as they are.

for example:
```python
N_gram("sample text", 3) -> ['sam', 'amp', 'mpl', 'ple', 'le ', 'e t', ' te', 'tex', 'ext'] 
N_gram("short", 8) -> "N is to Large" # N > len(txt)
N_gram("n is to small", -5) -> [] # N <= 
```
